texts.text: Your idea seemed to be made to help all the people living here. The bedridden ones, or the ones who can only move about for short periods of time.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It includes everyone, as long as they're cognizant. I felt that your desire to help as many as possible was really kind.
He studies me with his gaze.
A long silence descends on the lab.
But after a moment, his smile comes back, and he finally speaks again.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: ...Perhaps my venting was too heavy-handed.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I can see how you'd arrive at the conclusion that I am angry about the current state of things.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I've never given up on my research for that very same reason you speak of.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Frustration is no reason for being a sore loser, and it was unbecoming of me to let it poison my words. I hope you can forgive me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There's nothing to forgive...
He looks over the lab, and his gaze settles on the empty desks.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I couldn't make a single statement during today's debriefing. I simply stewed in my chair.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I read through the paper on oral medicine as well, but... It was easy to see how much my research is out of line with the prevailing trends.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Once upon a time, all the desks in this lab were in use.
I follow his gaze and look over the lab as well.
In total, there are fifteen empty desks.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Back then, all my lab's members were treated as researchers and given accommodation in the middle side.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It saddens me that I can't show you how the good times were.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: All researchers lived in the middle side...?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Our meetings were veritable clashes of ideas. My chest swelled with pride at the amount of young talent, just like yourself, that my lab was blessed with.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Among them was the one I started this laboratory with. A friend I lived joys and sorrows with throughout the years. I wish you could have known him.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Started the laboratory? Wasn't it just you at the beginning?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I merely had a way with words. He was the true genius behind the whole operation. I was always so jealous of him.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You? Jealous of someone?
The professor chuckles at my obvious consternation.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Does that surprise you?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Y-Yes. You always seemed so confident to me...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I'm simply sitting back and watching the years pass me by now, but there was a time when I was a passionate, hot-blooded youth just like you.
I gulped quietly.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: If a lab shows results, they are afforded more researchers—that's just how it is. Sadly, that number is zero for us right now.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I am certain that you would have been made a researcher by now if you chose a lab with more resources and people at its disposal. You have talent, Kaito.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You want to live in the middle side, yes?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yes.
It's the truth. That's one reason I'm here.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I'll support you. I know talent and hard work when I see it, and if you're not a researcher, I don't know who is.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I'll apply for a researcher slot, but as you can see, this lab hasn't achieved results in over a decade. Don't get your hopes up.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Then...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That means I must apply myself to research. If we see some results...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I could become a midsider too.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Exactly so. I will do my utmost to see it happen.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thank you.

After talking with the professor and expressing my interest in creating physics algorithms for the virtual space, Professor Asuma kindly gave me permission to make free use of the source code for the lab's sensory information manipulation software.
I wasn't sure what I'd say if he asked why I wanted it, and was glad that he didn't.
He's already done so much for me; I want to repay him with tangible results.
It would help him, and it'd help me to achieve my dream of living in the middle side.
The device developed in Asuma lab can already monitor the subject's brain waves and manipulate the thalamus externally.
Except for the sense of smell, it can recreate an immersive experience good enough to fool the brain into assuming it's reality.
The way smell is processed is much simpler than more complicated bodily functions such as sight, hearing, and balance.
When they made the device, they probably never expected that smell would be the one thing they couldn't recreate.
But it has already cleared the most difficult stages of sensory feedback processing.
By using this code, I can obtain detailed data of our brains when we're in Yonagi's dreamscape.
It'll also make the auxiliary device I need for the integrated dreamscape a lot simpler to create.
I actually have to strip away functions from it for what I need.
But this is still far more efficient than building it from the ground up.
Making the thing itself wouldn't be difficult.
However...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What constitutes... cute?
I mutter to myself.
I try to think of things and people in my life that I find cute.
The first things to pop in my mind are Yonagi and Izumo, naturally.
They're both very cute.
But I certainly couldn't model the device after them.
Yonagi would accuse me of having some kind of sick fetish again if I tried.
She had this weird habit of accusing me of having fetishes whenever something happened.
"Cute" will need to be found somewhere else.
I should be able to create something endearing enough in her eyes. Probably.
The second best thing would be...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: An animal?
Its job will be to convey what the both of us envision.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mmh... Dreams... Sleeping...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: When you sleep... you count sheep... Ah, yes!
The 3D printers have a function to make scanned images into three-dimensional objects.
But I must decide on a design first.
I need to create something that she can't help but find adorable...
I let my pen glide with purpose over the sheet of paper.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh?
This is actually the first time I've tried drawing anything.
And yet...
I feel absolutely certain that Yonagi will find this cute.
I'm sure I can communicate my feelings to her through this art.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You can do this, Kaito.
I feel like I finally started seeing the professor as something more than an idol today. Now he feels like a real person.
And I find myself enjoying my time with him more and more.
I'm really glad to have chosen his lab, despite everything.
His research has a strong, humane philosophy behind it.
He's not just chasing the latest technology.
It feels like the reasons we're doing this research are always at the forefront of his mind.
I want to help his research become recognized again.
I'm sure his idea is what will save this city in the end.
And now I have a part to play in it.
I've never faced such a daunting task in my life.
We have dinner together like usual, but I can't shake the restless feeling within me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Thanks for the porridge, Izumo. It was delicious!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It really was, thanks.
Izumo nods and quickly takes the empty dishes to wash.
Yonagi and I settle around the table to work like usual.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes?
Yonagi looks up at me and hugs the thick book she was poring over against her chest.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I've been thinking about something.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: About a design that you'd find cute, and that would be like family.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah, that thing from yesterday?
I nod in response.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You drew something?
I nod once more.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's super! I've never seen you draw before! I didn't know you could! Come on, show me!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I hope you like it...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yep, yep!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Here it is.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?
Yonagi freezes, her gaze pinned on the sketch.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What do you think?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wh-What...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wh-What's this? What is it?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Why does it... have those curly things popping out of its head?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I-Izumo?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: It's not in my data banks.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's thank God for that!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Since the dreamscape is like, well, a dream. Sheep are associated with sleep, so I incorporated that into the design.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: A sheep?! Th-That's a sheep?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, you might not remember, but sheep are—

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I know what a sheep is! Why do you think I'm losing my mind?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Don't you dare 'huh?' me! I'm the one who's confused here!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What even are those... hands? Wait, are they even hands?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm planning to allocate points of contact for communication there. It's basically a repeater for your image projections, so it has to be able to receive them from a short distance and send them to a network.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But if you somehow can't use your chip to communicate with it, you can hold its hand and...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hold?! Me? I-I have to hold its... its appendages?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And the bits protruding from its head are horn-shaped antennas.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Those two little sad hairs growing out of its bald head?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: They're not hairs, they're horns.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And what's going on in its rear? Is that... a tail? Oh, for the love of...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's a tail, but it's main purpose is to act as a propeller.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: A propeller?!
I smile and nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, that's the great part about it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It flies!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh hell no... Please tell me it ain't so...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Of course, it's not just the little propeller lifting it up.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's not what I meant!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I just thought it'd be cuter if its propeller spins as it hovers along.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Cute... What part of this is cute...?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It would be an auxiliary device for Izumo, so it would always be hovering behind her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: This thing?! All the time?! In OUR house?!
I nod proudly.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It know that sounds unbelievable, but it's okay. It can charge itself automatically, so it can stay floating indefinitely.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's not what I'm worried about!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wait a second now! Are you seriously telling me that this...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: This is your vision?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We're supposed to live together like this from now on?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You think this is cute?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Well, yes.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I won't stand for this!
When we come out of the dreamscape, Yonagi looks at the end of her rope.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What did I ever do to deserve this...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I told you, it's supposed to be a dream sheep, so I—

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Don't you dare!
Yonagi snatches my sketch and draws something next to it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: This is what a sheep looks like!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Sheep recognized.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Finally, some sanity!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I give you that it also looks like a sheep.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: This is LITERALLY the only thing on this paper that looks like a sheep!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But that's just a sheep.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: As for what cute looks like...!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's more like... like this!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Ooh!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But I...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: No buts, you butthead!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's a sheep and a robot, right? If it's supposed to fly behind Izumo...
Yonagi glances over at Izumo and puts the pen to her lips.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Maybe it could be white and have blue glowing accents on it?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Do it like this, or else.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh? Are you sure? It feels kind of...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Plain?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Better than staring at insanity floating in our house every day!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I concur.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What? Why are you sad about it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Well...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Maybe drawing wasn't my best idea...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Realizing you have a problem is the first step, sweetie. Well done.
It's been a few days since my confidence as an artist was absolutely crushed.
While I'm still not happy with how things turned out, I have come to realize that Yonagi's design might have some advantages over mine.
After much discussion, we decide on the design of Izumo's auxiliary unit.
And I had to reorganize its internal structure accordingly to make it work.
I print out the exterior, then put in the base for the lab's virtual simulator as well as the communication devices.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay. Izumo, scan your auxiliary unit.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: An open connection has been found.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can you connect to it?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Connection successful.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Cool.

texts.name: Support Terminal
texts.text: *Chirp*
It makes the sound just like I hoped it would.
The nature of the sound is a deliberate choice on my part.
I can't wait for Yonagi to hear it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm back, Izumo—Kaito?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Welcome home.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's so rare to see you home first!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I've been working here since noon.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Really? What have you been doing?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This.
I move one step to the right, revealing Izumo and...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah!
Yonagi's eyes glimmer when she catches sight of the floating auxiliary unit.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's super! You finished it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah. Everything inside of it is pretty much stuff I re-used from elsewhere. Professor Asuma said I could use it all.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Whoa!

texts.name: Support Terminal
texts.text: *Chirp*

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah! It spoke!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Not its most useful feature, I admit.
I say, the corners of my mouth rising into a shy little smile.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But I think it's a meaningful feature for the both of us, maybe.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: For us?

texts.name: Support Terminal
texts.text: *Chirp*

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wait...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can you tell what sound that is?

texts.name: Support Terminal
texts.text: *Chirp*

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The bird? The one we found in that middle side cave?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Bingo.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I found the chirps of the same kind of bird in the sound database, so I incorporated them into it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's set to chirp every time it finishes processing something.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito, give it a name.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: A name?
She smiled and nods.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It needs a name!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We should have given Mr. Birdie a real name.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Not just 'Mr. Birdie'... It would have been nice if we'd thought up a proper name for him...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, you're right.
Yonagi beams at me and nods.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You name it!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: M-Me? But you designed it.
She nods again.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's why! If I design it, and you name it, I think we'll love it like it's our own little baby.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Our... baby?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah!
Of course, I'd considered the possibility we might have a child someday.
Our child...
If that time ever comes...
I want it to be when we're living happily in the middle side.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Have any names in mind?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh? W-Well, yeah.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: When I tried designing it, I was thinking of the dreamscape, of sleep, and of dreams. That's why I went with a sheep motif.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So something relating to the design.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Real sheep have wool, and resting your head on wool helps sleep...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see. How about we call it Wooleep, then?
I shake my head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No, we call HIM Wooleep.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh, he's a boy?
I nod.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The pronoun matters that much?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Of course. We don't call Izumo 'it,' do we? Besides, it's cuter that way.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Really?
I nod enthusiastically.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Call him Wooleep. Are you okay with that, Izumo?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I will act accordingly to his creator's wishes.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Well, I suppose that's fine. Nice to meet you, little guy. We're family now!

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Chirp*
Perhaps I was wrong to think of it as a meaningless feature.
Strangely enough, simply hearing that little noise coming back in response is enough to make me feel a sense of attachment towards the robot.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay, now...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's make sure Wooleep is functioning correctly.
Her eyes light up as she realizes what I mean by that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You'll be able to talk now?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Maybe, if all goes according to plan.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's gonna be amazing! Let's try!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Before that...
Yonagi and I turn to Izumo.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I will prepare porridge.
She declares, before walking over to the kitchen.

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Chirp*
Wooleep lets out a sonorous chirp before chasing after Izumo.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It looks like Izumo's fond of him too.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I hope she is.
And then, after dinner...
We go into the dreamscape.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: A-Ah...
My voice spreads throughout the dreamscape.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: *Gasp*!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can you hear me?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I can hear you! I can't believe it! You're talking!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Finally.
I finally found a way.
I've studied for so long in order to make this happen.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's incredible! We can finally talk in here!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Now...
We need to make sure scent and sound behave as they should in this space.
But before that...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi.
She looks up at me, waiting for the words.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's go see Mom.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes!
We go to our house within the dreamscape.
When we arrive, Mom's on her bed.
Then she slowly turns towards us.
Just like she always did.
I glance at Yonagi.
She returns my gaze and smiles.
Her support encourages me, and I approach the bed.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mom.
It feels surreal to finally be hearing my own voice in this space.
Mom slowly turns her face up to me.
She's wearing that same gentle smile she always had for us.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Kaito, Yonagi.
Her voice stuns me for a brief moment.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mom...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi and I... We're doing well.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We're living together now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: With Izumo and Wooleep too!
Mom's smile widens as she looks up at us.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I see!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I'm glad to hear that, sweetie.
We come face to face for the first time in years, and we exchange words.
My conviction that this technology will save humankind only grows stronger.
Using this, everyone in the city will be able to experience life on the surface with their loved ones.
Reality is what we make of it, and this is reality.
There will be no lowsiders, no midsiders, no topsiders.
Everyone will be the same under the light of the sun, free from discrimination or hate.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This feeling...
Everything up to this point...
All those years reading and imagining a better life...
All the theorizing and testing...
Every thing up to this day has finally come together to make it possible.
Is this swelling emotion within my chest... what accomplishment feels like?
A sudden warmth spreads across my body. I can feel it, without a shadow of a doubt.
